sect1.title: Error Codes
sect1.para: When a Broker or agent is terminated, the exit code can be seen in the log file (for example oplrqb.log) or in the foreground window.
The exits codes are shown below:

row.entry: some kind of failure at startup/shutdown, typically shown with a reason for this error

When the exit code is not in the range of 0-15 then it is typically an uninitialised exit value taken from the stack. This can occur when an error in some database code is returned to the OpenLink code (Broker).

sect1.para: The agent or broker may be terminated with a signal:

row.entry: illegal instruction resulting in a program crash
misaligned mem read/write resulting in a program crash
divide by 0 or other arithmetical error
sent by the broker to kill an agent which has ignored multiple SIGTERMs
buffer/stack overrun resulting in a program crash
other side of a pipe was killed while this side tried to write data to it
sent by the broker to an agent to ask it to terminate

sect1.para: On the Windows platform, severe errors are reported in the following way:
The hex number may be looked up in the winnt.h file. All errors reported in this way are considered severe, and should be reported to OpenLink Support.
